results.title: Home from the Hill
results.creator_credit: Molly Dineen and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: After forty years of service in India and Africa, Colonel Hilary Hook returns home to England. We follow his journey from his Kenyan home and servants to an England very different from the one he left in 1948. This is a documentary about a dying breed of colonials. Colonel Hook represents those who once thought it was their responsibility to civilise the world, or a good part of it, only to find the world changing too fast for them to keep up. The pride with which Hook was prepared to cope, and the occasional despair when things proved too difficult, make him an absorbing central character and a remarkable microcosm of the fading British Empire. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Molly Dineen and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)

results.title: The Australian Royal Tours Collection 1901-1988
results.creator_credit: John Mandleberg, Film Australia and Aviva Ziegler
results.brief_description: A unique, visual cavalcade documenting the history of Australian tours by the British Royal Family since the turn of the century. It captures all the pomp and ceremony of the visits in the early 1900s by King George V, Edward the Prince of Wales and George VI, Queen Elizabeth’s first visit in 1954 and continues through to the younger generation of Royals with Diana and Fergie’s recent visits. Rated: G

results.title: Kingdom of the Lyrebird
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Jenny Erdos and Laszlo Erdos
results.brief_description: A unique film of one of the world’s rarest, largest and most spectacular songbirds. Includes extraordinary footage of the Lyrebird as it mimics the songs of some of the beautiful birds with which it shares its kingdom in Australia’s great Rainforests. Filmed entirely in the wild and narrated by Frederick Parslow. Rated: G

results.title: Efftee Entertainers
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films - all transferred directly from quality original 35mm nitrate negatives and prints. Filmed on state-of-the-art Mitchell cameras with RCA sound, these long forgotten, `shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the early 1930s.

results.title: Ramp Riot 111
results.brief_description: Watch the rad action of the world’s best skaters in “Ramp Riot 111” held at Festival Hall, Melbourne, in November 1989. Chris Miller, Jeff Phillips and Bod Boyle from the USA, battle the top Aussie skaters, Gary Valentine, Adam Luxford, Jason Ellis, Tony Hallam and Lee Ralph. This program highlights the unreal action from this event, including footage never seen before which was actually shot from inside the ramp.

results.title: The Peanut butter solution
results.brief_description: Nothing in 11 year old Michael Baskin’s vivid imagination can prepare him for the strange and enchanting adventure that he is about to embark on, an adventure that will change his life. Where an abandoned mansion holds a secret so frightening that it scares off little boys! Where friendly ghosts pass on magic potions made of peanut butter! Where an odd mystical artist paints pictures so real you can walk into them! And where magic and imagination are the most wonderful things of all. Rated: PG

results.title: Matter of heart
results.brief_description: This is an inspiring portrait of Carl Gustav Jung, a man whose genius and humanity caused his voice to reach far beyond the exclusive realm of psychiatry into redefining the essential nature of who we are and what we hope to become. More than just a linear biography, this program presents a fuller perspective of this healer, using rare home movies, archival footage, and a wealth of interviews.

results.title: The Best of Britain
results.creator_credit: Moviemaker Film and Television Production Co
results.brief_description: The Best of Britain takes you to nine of Britain’s most beautiful cities and towns. It is a detailed and colourful record of these historic places of interest, which represent a unique heritage and reflect the distinctive ambience which can only be described as the best of Britain. Rated: G

results.title: Stress and Tension
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
The causes and symptoms of stress are examined here, and we look at ways parents can stop feeling tired and run down. A variety of relaxation techniques are demonstrated, and we discuss ways of relieving loneliness. Mothers talk about the stress associated with trying to live up to other people’s expectations, especially when it comes to housework, and we provide hints on how to ease the housework load. Parents describe how they dealt with the anger they felt from the continual demands of their children, and we show how our parenting is influenced by the way we were brought up and what we can do to change it. There are hints on how to manage the end of the day and we discuss the value of your relationship with your partner in reducing stress.

results.title: To taste 100 herbs: gods, ancestors and medicine (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
A rich portrait of a traditional Chinese doctor and his special role in the community. The doctor discusses his Catholic religion, medical ethics, rural health services, handed-down knowledge of herbal treatments and Western medical practices. The warmth, closeness and traditions of family life in China are wonderfully captured in scenes of prayer, play, chores and celebrations.
